summary: This document is a letter from Citibank's Subpoena Compliance Unit, dated August 23, 2019, responding to a federal grand jury subpoena. It states that no credit card information was found for the individual(s) specified in the subpoena, referencing case #327098-001, and indicates a separate response regarding deposit accounts would be provided.

persons.name: Theresa Ann Muth
persons.context: Author of the letter from Citibank's Subpoena Compliance Unit responding to a federal grand jury subpoena regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: Citibank Response to Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: Citibank's Subpoena Compliance Unit sends a letter stating they did not locate any credit card information for the individual(s) specified in a federal grand jury subpoena related to the Epstein case.

keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to Citibank regarding the Epstein case.
Citibank's Subpoena Compliance Unit, via Theresa Ann Muth, responded that no credit card information was found for the specified individual(s).
The bank referenced its internal Case #327098-001 in relation to the subpoena.
The response indicates a separate communication regarding Citibank deposit accounts was or would be sent.
The document is part of the investigative record, showing financial inquiries were made by authorities.
